_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The origin of form, feeling, perception,: Mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to form
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
The origin of feeling, perception, choic: Mendicant approves, welcomes, and keeps clinging to feeling
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress
The ending of form, feeling, perception,: Mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, or keep clinging to form
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease
The ending of feeling, perception, choic: Mendicant doesn’t approve, welcome, or keep clinging to feeling
Old age and death, sorrow, lamentation, pain, sadness, and distress cease
